concepts: Programming is the process of creating instructions for computers using programming languages
Variables store data values that can be modified during program execution
Data types define the kind of data that can be stored (int, float, string, boolean)
Algorithms are step-by-step procedures for solving computational problems
Sequential execution runs statements one after another in order
Conditional statements (if-else) allow decision making in programs
Loops (for, while) enable repetitive execution of code blocks
Functions encapsulate reusable code blocks with parameters and return values
Arrays store multiple elements of same data type in contiguous memory
Lists provide dynamic storage with insertion and deletion operations
Stacks follow Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) principle for data access
Queues implement First-In-First-Out (FIFO) ordering for elements
